title: [Large-Scale] Language Learning Design Strategies Applying Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational language learning theories and understanding of educational design concepts
context.additional_context: Experimental design and analytical competency development for applying cognitive load theory to language education programs for working professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the three types of cognitive load (intrinsic, extraneous, and germane load)
Learners can modify and develop instructional materials by applying cognitive load theory-based design principles to language learning resources
Learners can propose at least two cognitive load management strategies tailored to learner characteristics in blended environments
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
